intro: Chuncoa chicharronia, commonly known as the Andean chuncoa, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Chuncoa chicharronia is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
